name: hexaconazole
Reason:
To predict the melting point of hexaconazole, we must quantitatively analyze the influence of its functional groups based on a reference compound. Benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C, will be our reference. The functional groups present in hexaconazole and their estimated effects on the melting point are as follows: 
- Triazole ring: +50°C (due to the ability to engage in hydrogen bonding and the presence of polar nitrogen atoms). 
- Dichlorophenyl group: +45°C (each chlorine atom on the phenyl ring likely contributes approximately +22.5°C due to increased molecular weight and polarity which results in stronger intermolecular interactions). 
- Tert-butyl group: +10°C (the addition of a tertiary butyl increases the melting point by making the molecule more sterically hindered and increasing the molecular weight). 
The sum of these additive effects should provide a rough prediction of the melting point of hexaconazole.
